column5: Started off in June, with my Bro selling me this.     It is my first boat and motor. I had done lots of fishing with my Dad, Grandfather and brother, but now i could fish whenever i had the urge.And i did a lot this past summer. First fish was a nice Pike.   Then the wife caught this drum.I can't get ger to touch fish yet,but i'm working on it   I was just happy catching fish, so the wife and i did the multi species thing,      Finished of the summer with my Brother on White Lake bass fishing in his Ranger.        I had a great time.Hopefully next year will be even better,now that i have a bit more experience behind me. Thanks to all the great tips and ideas i;ve picked up in here,i should be a better angler. Happy new Year to all of you OFNers Tite lines to you all.
thanks for sharing..great pics Best wishes in 2011..
Wow, awesome pics and a wonderful year that you have had.   Thank you for sharing  All the best to you in 2011. Happy New Years
nice looking pics.... but shouldn't the boat lettering be bi-lingual
Nice Multi Species for your 1st year with a boat, I haven't caught a Drum in years they sure put up a nice fight Happy New Years Everyone Richard
Nope, its an englsih boat. Comes from Johns Marina in Carleton Place.

Belated Merry Christmas to you Paul. It looks like we need to add a few LO salmon & rainbow to your species list.   Don't forget my invitation for July/August. Happy New Year to you and yours.  Regards, Simon

how did i miss this thread, and the chance to poke fun at you??????  ok lets see--- nice boat nice picture'S of lots of fish.  well guess i cant say much about that  ok i cant resist, why didnt you shave, you scruffy old bugger
Good show Mercman! You got some nice fishies there.

Hey !! I come for a long line of scruffy old men.A a matter of fact, i think i fit in here really well We can't all be rock stars Skeets. Besides, i dont like holding sharp objects near my throat so early in the morning.

I didn't miss this thread I've just been busier than a one-legged cat burying a turd on a frozen pond.  Looks like you, Barb and your brother had a good summer. I hope that 2011 is even better for you.

Great report and pics Paul You seem satisfied with the season results.... I know I would and the grin on the pics confirms it Thanks for sharing your time on the water with us!!! and good luck with the 2011 season Happy New Year to you too!!! Jacques
fine looking boat and fish too  looks like a great year to me
